basic.floral_language:
Sedum nussbaumerianum
Floriography: happy, lovely, beautiful
Sedum nussbaumerianum has an appearance similar to Sedum adolphii and can be easily confused. Has thinner and slender leaves than Sedum adolphii. Leaves pale green, when the temperature difference between day and night is big, leaves turn golden yellow to orange. Suitable for a variety of small combination of succulents or grown alone.
Sedum nussbaumerianum likes sunny days, has a short dormancy in summer, should be placed under scattered light. Flowers sometimes with beige flowers.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, cream white flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, with adequate sunlight, leaves turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: A short period of dormancy in summer, use half shade for better care, spring and autumn are its growing seasons, need plenty of sunshine
maintenance.watering: Water 2 times during summer dormancy, 20ml water every time, keep soil moist in other time, water thoroughly when soil is dry
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once monthly in spring and autumn, do not apply in other seasons
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
